text: Given that Henosia reasons about code (React + TypeScript in our case), it can measure spacing on the canvas when you wrap elements in a new Stack, setting the new spacing prop so layers stay put. This blurs the lines between the running program and the source code, but it just feels right to do UX design this way. Not sure what to call this. Maybe "spacing-aware coding" :thinking_face::grin:

elements.text: Given that Henosia reasons about code (React + TypeScript in our case), it can measure spacing on the canvas when you wrap elements in a new Stack, setting the new spacing prop so layers stay put. This blurs the lines between the running program and the source code, but it just feels right to do UX design this way. Not sure what to call this. Maybe "spacing-aware coding"
